title: 107_hr4155
content: The Act titled "District of Columbia Legislative Autonomy Act of 2002" eliminates congressional review of newly-passed District laws. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to remove congressional review of newly-passed District laws. Section 602 and section 604 are struck, with related amendments enacted by Congress. The rules of each House shall supersede other rules to the extent of inconsistency, with recognition of the constitutional right to change rules at any time. SEC. 3. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended in various sections, including changes to subsections and striking certain sentences. Payments by the District are specified to not be subject to appropriation. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to specify that payments by the District for revenue anticipation notes are not subject to appropriation. Amendments also include changes to subsections and striking certain sentences related to initiative and referendum laws. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to clarify that District payments for revenue anticipation notes are not subject to appropriation. Changes are made to subsections and sentences related to initiative and referendum laws. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to clarify that District payments for revenue anticipation notes are not subject to appropriation. Changes are made to subsections and sentences related to initiative and referendum laws, including modifications to certain sections of the act. The amendments made by this Act, effective from October 1, 2002, apply to acts of the District of Columbia passed by the Council and signed by the Mayor, vetoed by the Mayor and repassed by the Council, passed by the Council and allowed to become effective by the Mayor without signature, or ratified by a majority of registered qualified electors voting on the initiative or referendum.
